newsitem.title: UK: Euro VGO up on U.S. demand but business quiet.
newsitem.headline: Euro VGO up on U.S. demand but business quiet.

text.p: Better U.S. demand pushed VGO cargo prices up on Wednesday but little business appeared to be getting done, traders said.
A cargo of medium sulphur VGO traded on Tuesday for U.S. delivery at $134-135 a tonne fob with the high price reflecting its prompt nature.
Traders speculated that a cargo of prompt low sulphur material would fetch $140 if it could be found but those prepared to buy ahead need stump up $133-134 a tonne.
"Apart from the U.S. and a little bit of low sulphur demand from Germany the VGO market is very dead," said one trader.

U.S. interest has been prompted by poor crude refining margins forcing a switch to more profitable resid fuel cracking. But the problems at the Baytown and Bayway cracking plants may limit VGO buying now and put a cap on price rises, traders said.
